column4: for ubuntu 10.10  for the command sudo gedit /etc/network/interfaces, the guide I am using says to comment out everything but the lo command how di I do this?
anyone help?
put a # infront of the line you want to comment out
if you look at hte file you will see comments in there start with # The primary network interface   etc...
lspci | grep Network    Do that in a terminal
looking for the type of card that it outputs
most likely a broadcom bc43xx
Applications > Accesories > Terminal
then type in lspci | grep Network    and hit enter
case matters in Network
what is the bc43xxx part bc4321 etc???
the chipset
I believe you will need the broadcom STA driver.  Does this system have a wired port you can use to install it?
no I have wifi at my house and no wired cards
do you have another machine you can download stuff from?
the desktop I'm working on now
is the driver universal?
k and a thumb drive or cd to get the files there right?
yeah
I'm booting off of a usb
on this page https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/bcm43xx follow the STA - No Internet section
